text: Aspergillus montevidensis is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Aspergillus section. The species was first described in 1931.Talice, A.V. & Mackinnon, J.A. 1931, C.R. Séanc. Soc. Biol. Argentina 108: 1007 It has been reported to produce apolar indoloterpenes, asperflavin in few isolates, auroglaucin, dihydroauroglaucin, echinulins, epiheveadrides, flavoglaucin, isoechinulins, neoechinulins, and tetrahydroauroglaucin. ==Growth and morphology== A. montevidensis has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_montevidensis_cya.png|Aspergillus montevidensis growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_montevidensis_meaox.png|Aspergillus montevidensis growing on MEAOX plate == References == montevidensis Category:Fungi described in 1931
title: Aspergillus montevidensis
